We practice all Plum Village practices such as walking, sitting, touching the earth, total relaxation, beginning anew, singing PV songs and read an excerpt from Thay’s books before dharma sharing and end with a metta meditation. We recite the 5 Mindfulness trainings every other month.

properties.name: Lotus Bud Sangha
properties.description: We are a sangha in the Plum Village tradition, our teacher is Vietnamese Zen Buddhist monk Thich Naht Hanh (Thay) who passed away in January 2022. Thich Naht Hanh is one of the most prominent spiritual teachers of the 20th century. He was a peace activist, poet, author and most importantly a sangha builder. His teachings about mindfulness are unsurpassed. Lotus Bud Sangha was established by our dear Vietnamese dharma teachers in the 1980s who wanted to share this practice with the Vietnamese community and the wider Australian community. From those small but powerful beginnings we have a number of lay sanghas in Sydney and now our own meditation centre Mountain Spring Monastery at Bilpin.We would love to have you practice with us. What is practicing you may ask? In our sangha (community of meditators) we practice sitting and walking meditation, learn about the dharma (Buddhist teachings) and share about our experiences on the path of practice. We welcome beginners and experienced meditators as we learn from each other wherever we are in our practice. The group of regular facilitators at Lotus Buds are experienced meditators in the Plum Village tradition. We have been taught and guided by dharma teacher John Barclay who received the lamp transmission from Thich Nhat Hanh. John has been leading the sangha for many years, by teaching the dharma and mentoring many of us. He is also a Buddhist scripture teacher to primary and secondary students in Sydney. Meditation can be challenging at times however being in a sangha supports our practice and makes it easier. Being in a sangha with friends with shared values and a shared practice brings us joy and gives us energy. With weekly practice and spiritual friendships the path becomes easier and more beautiful.Each Wednesday we practice sitting and walking mediation, recite trainings, or explore a teaching and share our reflections. Most importantly we learn about how meditation and the Plum Village practices can help us in our daily lives. Thich Nhat Hanh’s teachings help us to transform our suffering so we can become more peaceful and happy. Wherever you may be in your meditation practice you are welcome to join us.

properties.name: Live Oak Sangha
properties.address: 820 N Fairview Avenue, Goleta, CA 93117, United States
properties.description: Live Oak Sangha is a mindfulness meditation group in the Plum Village Tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. We meet in a high quality hybrid format, with some people attending in person and some people attending by Zoom. Beginners, long time practitioners, and people who have never meditated but think they might like to explore a Buddhist practice are invited to join us. Our Sangha began practicing in 2004. We base our practices upon the Thich Nhat Hanh tradition. We start with a check-in, 20-minute silent sitting meditation and 10 minutes of walking meditation, followed by 30 minutes of dharma study. We may have another short silent sitting meditation and then our closing. During our Dharma time we study together from a common book, with occasional articles of interest or discussions of our individual practices. These include Thich Nhat Hanh and many other teachers’ works. We also sometimes participate in retreats or special events in the area. Everyone is welcome!

properties.name: 3 Jewels Sangha
properties.description:
I am starting a new sangha as a way to reach people in need of a beloved community. We are only meeting online currently but I hope to have a physical space where we can practice in person. I am hoping to build a community steeped in the Plum Village tradition and growing an OI team to support many local in person people, but also offering our current virtual meetings either as a hybrid meeting or separate way to reach remote connections seeking a solid community focused on mindful living and engaged buddhism.
We currently are doing book studies (currently We Were Made For These Times book) and basic sitting meditation. My goal is to build a regular weekly practice of Sitting, Walking, Silent meditation, followed by a Dharma Talk (using books, articles, or videos by Thay and others) to offer a deeper lesson then community discussion time to share. I'd like to offer tea in our discussion time.
As we grow I would like to start having Quarterly Days of Mindfulness. I would eventually like to build an annual retreat for the DFW community as we do not have anything like this locally yet. I will be leaning on OI and Dharma Teachers when we get to that stage but right now it is only myself facilitating.

properties.name: Ipswich Sangha
properties.address: Barham Church Hall, Church Road, Barham, IP6 0PTIpswich, East Anglia, United Kingdom
properties.meeting: In-person and on Zoom every Thursday evening 6.30-7.30.
properties.description: Our Sangha was founded in 2001 by 6 members who had just been to Plum Village, the monastic community in France where Vietnamese Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh (or “Thay”) is based. (“Thay” means “Teacher” in Vietnamese)We meet (in-person and on Zoom) every Thursday evening 6.30-7.30. We are funded by donations quarterly or £2 on the night. In summer we meet at Barham Church Hall, Church Road, Barham, IP6 0PT , and in winter in each others’ homes. After a few minutes discussing business, the evening starts with a guided meditation, led in turn by the members, followed by a Tea Ceremony and a Dharma sharing. In the Dharma sharing we benefit from each other’s insights and experience of the practice. We listen deeply while members share their experiences, and refrain from giving advice. Whatever is shared is confidential.A small Dharma Study group meets every 1 or 2 months, at a member’s home, to watch a DVD of a talk by Thay.We hold a Morning of Mindfulness every 2nd Saturday of the month, 10am-1.00pm. This includes walking meditation, sitting meditation and other activities such as Touching the Earth, watching a video of Thay, Dharma sharing, etc. We all bring food and drink to share. For several years, we have organised an annual weekend retreat, in a hired centre.Any surplus donations are shared between Thay’s charities in Vietnam and the Community of Interbeing’s Practice Centre Project and Bursary Fund.Contact Isabelle for venues (isabellewen@hotmail.com or (01473)422155Our Mindfulness PracticeOur Sangha practises the art of mindfulness. Our breath is an essential element in our practice of mindfulness. It is always with us and unites our body and mind. The sound of the bell is also a central feature as it reminds us to come back to our breath and dwell in the present moment.Sitting meditation – There are many different postures recommended for sitting meditation. Thay recommends that we adopt a position where we feel comfortable and alert. This maybe cross-legged on a cushion, legs tucked underneath a stool or sitting upright on an ordinary chair. The breath should be deep and light. Our back should be straight. Our hands resting lightly in our lap or our knees. Our eyes can be lightly open or closed, and our mouth ideally in a gentle smile.The period of meditation begins with 3 sounds of the bell and is brought to a close with 3 sounds of the bell.Walking Meditation – When we practise walking meditation the breath is co-ordinated with our steps. When we hear the bell to start we take an in-breath and make one step with the left foot. On the out breath we take another step with the right foot. Then the cycle begins again. Throughout we are continually aware of the body.Recommended reading – “The Blooming of the Lotus”, “The Miracle of Mindfulness”, both by Thich Nhat Hanh.

We have Days of Mindfulness throughout the year and Mindful Fell Walking events in South Lakeland. Anyone interested in joining is welcome. properties.name: London (Dulwich) - Dulwich Sangha
properties.meeting: Tuesdays, 7pm-8:30pm or 7pm - 9pm. Walking Meditation fortnightly on Thursday.
properties.description:
The Dulwich Sangha is a long-established sangha. It was started by Maire Pompe, our oldest member and “Holder of the Lamp” in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh, but we also welcome people from all traditions.
The format of the evening is inspired by Plum Village.

We meet online every Tuesday, except in August. Two of these meetings each month are also in person. We have two shorter (7 – 8.30 pm) and two longer (7 – 9 pm) meetings, all with sitting and walking meditation and ‘sharing’. At the longer meetings we generally have a presentation as well.

We also hold a number of Mindfulness Saturdays each year.
In addition a walking meditation group meets every other Thursday from 12.30 to 2.30 pm.

Stella Chapman co-ordinates the schedules and circulates weekly Zoom links and monthly schedules, along with other relevant information. Please contact her for more details.

properties.description: The Heart of Manchester Sangha meets in person (not online). Our newsletter goes out monthly with more details of our meetings below. Please email heartofmanchesterstockportsanghas@outlook.com to go on the list, which does not commit you to attending. We welcome new members.We hold our our regular Sunday Sangha in a beautiful venue for which we pay rent to use. There is no fixed cost but a contribution from practitioners means we can continue to use the hall. For those who don’t carry cash or would prefer to make an online annual or monthly donation our details are as follows:The Heart of Manchester SanghaAccount Number: 41469345Sort Code: 09-01-29 All contributions are welcome.Sunday evenings (7.30–9.30 pm.) every Sunday, unless it clashes with a carol service at Christmas. The first hour or so of our practice includes guided meditation, a reading, walking meditation and silent meditation. Then an informal tea break, followed by mindful sharing – practising loving speech and deep listening.Five Mindfulness Training Meetings on the second Sunday evening of each month (7.30–9.30 pm.), reciting the trainings is woven into the shape of an evening session, as above.Monthly Saturday Morning Meetings on the second Saturday of the month we hold a session similar in form to the Sunday evenings. (10.30 am.–12.30 pm.)Days of Mindfulness three times a year, in January, May and September, we share a day in the company of one another, deepening our mindfulness practice through a range of meditations and sharing. Rough guide of programme is arrive 10.15 am. for 10.30 start, finishing at 4.00 pm. Please bring ready prepared vegetarian lunch to share. Please contact us at heartofmanchestersangha@gmail.com for more information.Solstice meetings twice a year, near to the winter and summer solstices we meet for a little longer (4.30–9.30) to enjoy a guided deep relaxation followed by an informal meal before the evening session. Please bring food for yourself and/or to share.We hold our meetings in the Chorlton Unitarian Church.

properties.name: Singing Bell Sangha
properties.meeting: Monday's through Wednesday's (check website for specific information)
properties.description: The Singing Bell Sangha roots itself in the Plum Village Tradition, taught by Thich Nhat Hanh (Thay) and his disciples. We use Thay’s words, freely shared with us through his many books and teachings and these words support us to grow in love, compassion, understanding and awareness.The Singing Bell Sangha is affiliated with Plum Village UK and as such some of the meditation sittings listed below are facilitated by Plum Village UK Lay Dharma teachers. Links to the practices provided by Plum Village UK can be found here: https://plumvillage.uk/Our weekly calendar looks like this:MONDAY MORNINGS: “FROM THE HEART” 08.30Offered via Facebook Live, the “From The Heart” sessions are a time where Andy shares a brief reading from Thay’s books, starting and closing with a brief meditation. From the Heart can be accessed from this page. Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/558068675090521WEDNESDAY SANGHA SITTING, 18.30 – 20.00Our Wednesday night Sangha Sitting is provided via Zoom. We sit and share some of Thay’s teachings, such as working through a book together. We then meditate on what we have heard and enjoy a time of dharma sharing at the end. The link for these sessions is posted on the Singing Bowl Sangha page, usually the day before the sitting.Attending these practices does not tie you into anything, there are no conditions, expectations, obligations, or requirements and, best of all, there’s no fee! They are simply offered to support us all to progress in our path.Welcome! With a smile, Andy

We remove our shoes so warm socks are a must especially in the winter! During the evening we enjoy guided meditations, slow walking meditation and silent sitting meditation. We meet from 7:15pm to 9:15pm on the first and third Thursdays of the month. We also meet online on the 2nd and 4th Thursday of the month from 7:30pm – 8:30pm. properties.name: Alberta - Going as a River Edmonton Sangha
properties.address: Riverdale Rinkhouse, 9928 92 St NW, Edmonton, AB T5H 0A4, Canada
properties.description: Going As A River Edmonton Sangha practices in the tradition of Vietnamese Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. Weekly practice includes sitting meditation; walking meditation; Dharma sharing; exploration of Dharma talks, Sutras as well as other readings and commentaries; Chants and practice songs. We also share in a monthly recitation of the 5 Mindfulness Trainings on the first meeting of each month. Please visit our website for more information and updates. Everyone is welcome!

properties.name: Dawning Light Sangha
properties.address: 470 40 St S, Lethbridge, AB T1J 3Z5, Canada
properties.description: An inclusive group of inter-spiritual practitioners, practicing in the Plum Village tradition.

properties.name: Ontario - Qi Wellness Sangha
properties.address: McClintock Way, Kanata, ON K2L 2A2 Canada
properties.description: A small sangha who practice daily sitting and walking meditation and teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh. Breathing in, I know I am breathing in. Breathing out, I know I am breathing out.

properties.name: Wake Up Vienna (Wien)
properties.description: We are a young Sangha (aprox. 18-35). We come together to practice mindfulness, totake care of ourselves, nurture our happiness and contribute to buildinga healthier and more compassionate society.

properties.name: Wake Up Haarlem
properties.description: We come together every 3 weeks on Tuesday at 19:30. All information can be found at https://www.wakeuphaarlem.nl

properties.name: Wake Up Barcelona
properties.description: Jóvenes adultos (Wake Up). We meet every saturday in the forest of Baixador de Vallvidrera from 11am to 13am and usually we do picnic lunch all together afterwards.

properties.name: Wake Up Toronto
properties.meeting: Monday evenings. In-person at the University of Toronto & online on Zoom.
properties.description: Find updates on our schedule on Instagram (@wake.up.toronto) or our website. We practice in person at the University of Toronto, 569 Spadina Ave, 2nd floor, Main Activity Hall; and also on Zoom: https://utoronto.zoom.us/j/94210270985 Meeting ID: 942 1027 0985.
